thread.title: Cinema screenings of Sherlock special 'The Abominable Bride' come with added bonus content - Sherlock Cult -
thread.title_full: Cinema screenings of Sherlock special 'The Abominable Bride' come with added bonus content - Sherlock News - Cult - Digital Spy

author: Megan Davies
title: Cinema screenings of Sherlock special 'The Abominable Bride' come with added bonus content - Sherlock Cult -
text: Over 100 cinemas will be simulcasting the highly-anticipated Sherlock special on January 1, 2016, and now BBC is sharing further details of what fans can expect from the screenings.And if the words 'exclusive bonus content' don't appeal to you, we suggest you look away now. © BBC In addition to showing the one-off, 90-minute Victorian special, those who book their seats will also get to see extra filmed material, including a guided tour of 221B Baker Street from co-creator Steven Moffat and a look behind the scenes at how the episode was made, featuring the lead cast and crew.The upcoming special's title - 'The Abominable Bride' - was announced today (October 24) during the Sherlock panel at MCM London Comic Con, where it was also confirmed that fans could book their cinema tickets from Monday, November 2."Sherlock on the big screen. For us, it's a giant leap backwards - into Victorian London," Moffat said in a statement. "The mean streets of 1895 have never looked so good!" © BBC Benedict Cumberbatch and Martin Freeman will reprise their roles as Holmes and Watson in the special, while regulars Rupert Graves, Una Stubbs, Louise Brealey and Amanda Abbingdon are all also set to return.Further countries participating in showing Sherlock in cinemas will be confirmed in due course, although last week it was confirmed that China will be involved in screening the special.For full listings of participating UK cinemas, visit Sherlockology.Watch a trailer for the special below:
